        Parameters:

        clientId - the MQTT client's id. Auto-generated if null.

    • Method Detail

      • fromProperties

        public static MqttConfig fromProperties(java.util.Properties properties)
        Create a new configuration from Properties.

        There is a property corresponding to each MqttConfig.set<name>() method. Unless otherwise stated, the property's value is a string of the corresponding method's argument type. Properties not specified yield a configuration value as described by and their corresponding set<name>().

        Properties other than those noted are ignored.

        MQTT connector properties

        • mqtt.actionTimeToWaitMillis
        • mqtt.cleanSession
        • mqtt.clientId
        • mqtt.connectionTimeoutSec
        • mqtt.idleTimeoutSec
        • mqtt.keepAliveSec
        • mqtt.password
        • mqtt.persistence
        • mqtt.serverURLs - csv list of MQTT URLs of the form: tcp://<host>:<port>
        • mqtt.subscriberIdleReconnectIntervalSec
        • mqtt.userName
        • mqtt.will - JSON for with the following properties:
          • topic - string
          • payload - string for byte[] in UTF8
          • qos - integer
          • retained - boolean
        Parameters:
        properties - properties specifying the configuration.
        Returns:
        the configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - for illegal values

      • setActionTimeToWaitMillis

        public void setActionTimeToWaitMillis(long actionTimeToWaitMillis)
        Maximum time to wait for an action (e.g., publish message) to complete.

        Optional. default: -1 no timeout. 0 also means no timeout.

        Parameters:
        actionTimeToWaitMillis -

        optional. default: use memory persistence.

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public void setConnectionTimeout(int connectionTimeoutSec)
        Connection timeout. Optional. 0 disables the timeout / blocks until connected. default: 30 seconds.
        Parameters:
        connectionTimeoutSec -

      • setIdleTimeout

        public void setIdleTimeout(int idleTimeoutSec)
        Idle connection timeout. Optional. 0 disables idle connection disconnect. default: 0 seconds (disabled).

        Following an idle disconnect, the connector will automatically reconnect when it receives a new tuple to publish. If the connector is subscribing to topics, it will also reconnect as per setSubscriberIdleReconnectInterval(int).

        Parameters:
        idleTimeoutSec -
        See Also:
        setSubscriberIdleReconnectInterval(int)

      • setSubscriberIdleReconnectInterval

        public void setSubscriberIdleReconnectInterval(int seconds)
        Subscriber idle reconnect interval.

        Following an idle disconnect, if the connector is subscribing to topics, it will reconnect after the specified interval. Optional. default: 60 seconds.

        Parameters:
        seconds -

      • setKeepAliveInterval

        public void setKeepAliveInterval(int keepAliveSec)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Connection Keep alive.

        Optional. 0 disables keepalive processing. default: 60 seconds.

        Parameters:
        keepAliveSec -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • setServerURLs

        public void setServerURLs(java.lang.String[] serverUrls)
        MQTT Server URLs

        Required. Must be an array of one or more MQTT server URLs. When connecting, the first URL that successfully connects is used.

        Parameters:
        serverUrls -

      • setWill

        public void setWill(java.lang.String topic,
                    byte[] payload,
                    int qos,
                    boolean retained)
        Last Will and Testament.

        optional. default: no last-will-and-testament.

        Parameters:
        topic - topic to publish to
        payload - the last-will-and-testament message value
        qos - the quality of service to use to publish the message
        retained - true to retain the message across connections
